description: {"blocks":[{"key":"frh71","text":"Mosquito insectaries must be maintained around the clock without interruption, due to the lack of preservation procedures. Long-term maintenance of mosquito colonies can lead to population bottlenecks, laboratory adaptation, loss of genetic\nmarkers, etc., leading to colonies that are attenuated and different from their wildtype counterparts. Cryopreservation is an essential tool to combat these challenges that has been developed in other insects, including silkworms, fruit flies, and honey bees. Unfortunately, there is no robust method of cryopreservation for mosquitoes. This protocol details the short-term freezing of Anopheles stephensi (Mosquito) larvae; an initial step towards establishing a cryopreservation method for mosquito larvae.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"coqdn","text":"Mosquito eggs on egg paper","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ckot","text":"Insectary chamber, capable of programable temperature, light, and humidity","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2of88","text":"Distilled water","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjt8n","text":"Fish food","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7j6j3","text":"Small hatch bin (a solid, polycarbonate or greater strength container, that can hold water to a depth of 5 or more cm, with dimensions approximately 10 cm x 20 cm)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3el5j","text":"Two (or more) Large Hatch bins (dimensions approximately 20 cm x 40 cm)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bets8","text":"Plastic transfer pipettes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8njfe","text":"Strainer","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2a576","text":"Gloves","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7muo","text":"Small (2 oz) disposable cups","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61fq1","text":"Insect rearing cage with nylon mesh screen and port","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8oork","text":"Scissors","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3b5da","text":"Circulating water pump","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1nrk5","text":"Glass insect feeder","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bvjs","text":"Parafilm","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8857","text":"Filter paper","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9le5k","text":"Defibrinated calf blood","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7uh3e","text":"Microscope slides","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bart","text":"Olympus SZX16 Advanced Stereo Microscope (or similar)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1oetu","text":"Penetrating cryoprotective agents (see examples, section III.A","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eq2ed","text":"Non-penetrating cryoprotective agents (we use 0.5 M Trehalose)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7tkm1","text":"Square culture (petri) plates","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbisk","text":"FalconTM Cell Strainers, 70 um (or similar)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fppj2","text":"Thermoelectric Laboratory Cold Plate (AHP-1200CPV or similar)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4e5v","text":"Kim wipes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase I: Establish and maintain mosquito colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5fiir","text":" Phenotypic Analysis of developing mosquitoes (Figure 1)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":56}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9trb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f415n","text":"Larvae develop from eggs to first instar larvae (L1) around 2-3 days after transferring egg paper.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hooj","text":"L1 develop into L2/L3 over the next 4 days (approximately). During that time, they show the","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27ba8","text":"ability to hatch, feed and further develop. L4 transition into pupa and emerge as adults","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8cej6","text":"approximately 2 days after pupation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cu6ti","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkd30","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"g7c","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"euoaj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":359,"id":452773,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"6trgu\",\"text\":\"An. stephensi life stages showing hatch and maturation rate data collection points\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/p4fhbixhx.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/p4ffbixhx.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/p4fgbixhx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/p4febixhx.webp","width":550}}}}

steps.section: Phase I: Establish and maintain mosquito colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"s5bp","text":"Husbandry (modified from MR4 Methods in Anopheles Research. MR4 Methods in \nAnopheles Research Laboratory Manual, BEI Resources, 2015)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":134}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase I: Establish and maintain mosquito colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9u6cv","text":"1. Hatch eggs","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ficj1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cosb4","text":"Obtain egg paper with referenced eggs from BEI or other qualified source. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"41ov9","text":"Take clean small hatch bin, label with date, and fill with ~  of distilled water. Dispense water slowly to avoid bubbles (eggs will hatch asynchronously if bubbles are present).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":60,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bqt71","text":"Put on gloves and place the egg paper into the water.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57fj5","text":"Add a pinch of fish food and cover the bin. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"duv04","text":"Place bin in insect chamber and maintain under controlled conditions of temperature ( ), relative humidity (70%) and light (12:12 L:D diurnal cycle).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":85,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3ioe4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"28","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Phase I: Establish and maintain mosquito colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2t31j","text":"2. Larvae splitting and feeding","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bm3cb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"82m54","text":"Slowly fill a large hatch bin with water. Tap or distilled water can be used. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehu9r","text":"Move larvae into a larger bin using a strainer, roughly 24 hours after eggs are hatched. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"78nvh","text":"Make sure to thoroughly rinse out the small bin where eggs were hatched to ensure all larvae are transferred to the large bin. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6e4sn","text":"For the following days, make sure that bins are not over saturated with larvae (~60% saturation), or else the larvae will stop maturing; split larvae between current bin and new bin as much as necessary. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"917k7","text":"Add food and cover bin to any new bins prepared. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9oc4","text":"Changing the water may be necessary to avoid mold and other microbial growth; Use strainers and transfer larvae into a fresh bin if necessary.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase I: Establish and maintain mosquito colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"pbsa","text":"3. Collecting pupae","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6fpvr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b06pr","text":"Pour an ounce of tap water into a clear, plastic, disposable 2oz (about 59.15 ml) cup. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8i1g4","text":"Use a transfer pipette or a small mesh-made-scoop to collect the pupae into the cup.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"44cj7","text":"Transfer the cup into an insect rearing cage by placing cup through top port. Add sugar and water cups through the port.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hrru","text":"Males will emerge first, so it is important to pick up pupae every day for several days (~ ) to ensure females emerging from pupae are also picked.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":90,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":432000,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: Phase I: Establish and maintain mosquito colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e5uv","text":"4. Blood feeding mosquitoes (glass feeder protocol)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":51}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2pm0t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"793nb","text":"The optimal time to blood feed mosquitoes is 3-5 days post-eclosion.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79ls9","text":"Remove sugar and water 12-16 hrs prior to blood feed.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"25ug1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b47n9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cv6u1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4j5n5","text":"Fill water basin with tap water and attach heating element/pump. Turn on and pre-warm water to   –  .","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":95,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":99,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cke97","text":"Prepare glass feeders. Use scissors to cut the length of parafilm or hog gut sufficient to cover mouth of glass feeder. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"am6kh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47ac7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ep8lg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8e9i","text":"Briefly turn off the water pump and use plastic tubing to connect all feeders in a circuit that leads back into the water bath. Wet each end of each piece of plastic tubing before use to ensure easier fit. Turn pump back on and ensure A) a steady flow of water around circuit and B) no dripping. Do not, however, place feeders on top of rearing cages yet, as mosquitoes may begin to drink and fill up on water.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4s3rp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"enps3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1jknb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpcko","text":"Briefly turn off the water pump and use plastic tubing to connect all feeders in a circuit that leads back into the water bath. (Wet each end of each piece of plastic tubing before use to ensure easier fit.) Turn pump back on and ensure ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fnh3","text":"a steady flow of water around circuit and ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f7gr4","text":"no dripping. Do not, however, place feeders on top of cartons yet, as mosquitoes may begin to drink and fill up on water.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5i422","text":"Use transfer pipette to measure appropriate amount of blood into well of glass feeder.  -  per feeder is more than enough.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":87,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":89,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"36ir3","text":"Place feeders on top of cartons and begin feeding. Optional: tear off a long strip of tape to hold glass feeder firmly in place against roof of mosquito carton.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5973i","text":"Visually inspect mosquitoes to see if they are feeding. Look for females clustered around feeder with bright red full bellies. Ensure that the temperature of the water is approximately  . Some variability in temperature is permissible but note that parafilm may melt/deform if bath is run too hot.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":7,"offset":185,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7m90a","text":"Allow mosquitoes to feed for up to  . Return all mosquito cartons to insectary and disassemble water bath apparatus.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":8,"offset":35,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"rhl3","text":"Let glass feeder and membrane soak in 10% bleach solution for at least  . Dispose of membrane and rubber band in trash. Wash glass feeder and let dry.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":9,"offset":71,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f1pat","text":"Eggs are laid roughly 48 hrs after the blood meal. Collect eggs onto filter paper and continue the process to maintain colony.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"euf69","text":"The colony will significantly die off if starved for more than 24 hrs.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"42","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4qemj","text":"Hog gut is often stored frozen. Allow time to thaw before use or thaw in tap water.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"4":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"v3om","text":"If hog gut is used, be careful not to let it dry out. A petri dish with wet paper towels may be used for this purpose. Do not place prepared glass feeders in petri dish with standing water as the water may enter the feeder through the membrane and dilute the blood.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"5":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"6":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"7":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"8":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"9":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: Phase I: Establish and maintain mosquito colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9jpec","text":"C. Obtaining and counting larvae","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase I: Establish and maintain mosquito colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dj5v3","text":"At 16- 18 hrs post-egg hatching, remove An. stephensi larvae hatch bin.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase I: Establish and maintain mosquito colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"63lqm","text":"Transfer a small amount of water from the hatching habitat to a clean bin lid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase I: Establish and maintain mosquito colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fg6q1","text":"Cut the tip of a plastic bulb pipette with scissors, approximately 1cm above the tip, to widen the inlet area of the pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase I: Establish and maintain mosquito colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cr9ei","text":"Remove 7-20 larvae at a time by pipetting, transfer to water on clean bin lid, and count the larvae collected into the water drops. Continue quickly, until all larvae are counted, or the number needed for experiments are collected.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase I: Establish and maintain mosquito colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"87vh","text":"Transfer to a clean bin lid containing hatch bin water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase I: Establish and maintain mosquito colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fsj4v","text":"After larvae are counted, transfer them back to the original habitat, along with the water from the new hatch bin.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase I: Establish and maintain mosquito colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"carau","text":"D. Phenotypic Characterization of Larvae at each Instar by Advanced Stereo \nMicroscope (Larval Microscopy)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":106}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase I: Establish and maintain mosquito colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1alq1","text":"Cut the tip of a plastic bulb pipette with scissors, approximately 1cm above the tip, to widen the inlet area of the pipette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase I: Establish and maintain mosquito colony
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2ndin","text":"Remove 5-7 larvae from their hatch bin, and transfer in one drop to a glass microscope slide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase I: Establish and maintain mosquito colony

steps.section: Phase 2: Freezing and Recovery of L1 Larvae
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"enfjr","text":"Collect 50 or more L1 larvae from the insectary bin using a transfer pipette with a blunt end and transfer onto a filter dish.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase 2: Freezing and Recovery of L1 Larvae
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3e9c1","text":"Lift filter basket with larvae out of the water, blot the sides of the basket to remove excess water, and submerge the basket into a Petri dish containing   EG,   ML,   DMSO, or   MA/MF, or water alone (control) and hold for 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, or   at  ( - ).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":155,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":161,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":167,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":178,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":246,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":251,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":253,"length":1},{"key":7,"offset":255,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7i21g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"1.5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":21}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"1.5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":21}},"2":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"1.5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":21}},"3":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"1.5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":21}},"4":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":28800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"5":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"6":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"22","unit":10}},"7":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"25","unit":10}}}}

steps.section: Phase 2: Freezing and Recovery of L1 Larvae
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7ato6","text":"After the appropriate exposure time, lift the basket out of the respective CPA dish and rinse larva by immersion in tap water while they remain in the filter basket.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase 2: Freezing and Recovery of L1 Larvae
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9b4i6","text":"Repeat step three two more times, or empirically based on loss of glossy sheen on the L1 larvae.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase 2: Freezing and Recovery of L1 Larvae
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"11avb","text":"Culture the L1 larvae in water with fish food (as described in Step 2.1) and assess for survival based morphological changes from L1-L4 larvae. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase 2: Freezing and Recovery of L1 Larvae
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d8ahp","text":"Determine the percent survival (Percent survival = # of pupae collected/initial egg count) for each time point for a given CPA solution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase 2: Freezing and Recovery of L1 Larvae

steps.section: Phase 2: Freezing and Recovery of L1 Larvae

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bfido","text":"Begin rapid cooling of L1 Larvae on cooling table, and cool to  using a rate of 0.65-0.7 degrees / min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":63,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-15","unit":10}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dejuq","text":"After this time, collect the L1 larvae using a clipped transfer pipette and transfer them to a square dish with water held at   for 1- . steps.section: Phase 2: Freezing and Recovery of L1 Larvae
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6rn1t","text":"Return L1 larvae to husbandry conditions for recovery and development through life stages (Figure 1). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":91,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase 2: Freezing and Recovery of L1 Larvae
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8qpaj","text":"Determine recovery and analysis of viability as described below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase 2: Freezing and Recovery of L1 Larvae
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dhu2o","text":"Determine the number of pupae that emerge from each freezing incubation time point; calculate the percent recovery as done for percent survival, based on number of L1 larvae from each time point. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase 2: Freezing and Recovery of L1 Larvae
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"flh3c","text":"Determine the percentage of recovered pupae that survive and develop into adults. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase 2: Freezing and Recovery of L1 Larvae
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6e2j4","text":"Determine the ratio of males to females (sexual differentiation) in adult mosquitoes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase 2: Freezing and Recovery of L1 Larvae
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"al1rj","text":"Perform phenotypic similarity analyses (via microscopy; section I.C. of this protocol)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase 2: Freezing and Recovery of L1 Larvae
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"68ng9","text":"Determine the number of eggs subsequently produced from adults maturing after recovery from cryopreservation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Phase 2: Freezing and Recovery of L1 Larvae
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"104u1","text":"Determine the number of larvae (F2) hatching from eggs produced by adults that matured after recovery from freezing to confirm the colony has returned to healthy, normal husbandry conditions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
